title: save-analysis fails with proc macro and nested generic type

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-dev-tools
labels.description: Relevant to the dev-tools subteam, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-save-analysis
labels.description: Area: saving results of analyses such as inference and borrowck results to a file.

body:
rls shows it as warning, but all codes after the field are not analyzed (including sibling modules). And rls ICEs on dependent crate.



Warning from rls-vscode:

[rustc] librustc_save_analysis\span_utils.rs:156: Mis-counted brackets when breaking path? Parsing 'Box<Expr>>' in ecmascript\ast\src\class.rs, line 10




<details>
    <summary>
Backtrace (from wsl, because my windows rustc doesn't produce any stacktrace)</summary>

```

}

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.25.0-nightly (56733bc9f 2018-02-01) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
```
